org.judal.storage.table.impl

Class AbstractRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.judal.storage.table.impl.AbstractRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Stored, Record

    public abstract class AbstractRecord
extends java.lang.Object
implements Record

    Partial implementation of Record interface.

    The actual storage of rows is determined by a subclass. It may be storing each row as Java member variables, an array or as a map depending on whether PojoRecord, ArrayRecord, MapRecord is used.

    Each AbstractRecord is associated with an underlying ViewDef or TableDef which describes the list of columns held by the Record. The ViewDef or TableDef may represent an actual table or view in the database or may be generated on the fly to represent any set of columns.

    If the actual implementation is of type MapRecord, then the Record may hold more columns than just the ones described in the ViewDef/TableDef. This is in order to accommodate varying columns list from schemaless storage systems or growing column families from column-oriented databases.

    It is possible to associate a ConstraintsChecker and a FieldHelper to the Record. These classes help to perform client-side validations on data integrity and custom type conversion for non-standard types of a database.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergio Montoro Ten
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • remove

        public abstract java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.String colname)

        Remove value of a column.

        This method may have different behaviors depending on the implementation. For MapRecord subclass, removing a column will cause that it won't be updated in the database. But for ArrayRecord and PojoRecord, removing a column will set it to null or cause an exception.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Record
        Parameters:
        colname - String Column Name
        Returns:
        Object Previous column value

      • store

        public void store(DataSource oDts)
           throws javax.jdo.JDOException,
                  java.lang.ClassCastException

        Store this Record using given DataSource.

        A store operation will insert the Record if it does not exist or update it if already exists. If a ConstraintsChecker has been set, its check() method will be called before attempting to store the Record. This may result in a JDOException thrown if the Record does not comply with the constraints.
        Specified by:
        store in interface Stored
        Parameters:
        oDts - TableDataSource
        Throws:
        javax.jdo.JDOException
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If oDts is not an instance of class TableDataSource or a subclass of it.

This may result in a JDOException thrown if the Record does not comply with the constraints.

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(java.lang.String sColName)

        Get column as byte array.

        If the column value is null then null will be returned Else If the column type is byte[] that same value will be returned Else this method will call org.judal.serialization.BytesConverter.toBytes(value, getColumn(sColName).getType()) to convert the column Object into a byte array.
        Specified by:

      • toXML

        public java.lang.String toXML(java.lang.String identSpaces,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attribs,
                              java.text.DateFormat dateFormat,
                              java.text.NumberFormat decimalFormat,
                              java.text.Format textFormat)
        Write Record as XML.
        Parameters:
        identSpaces - String Number of indentation spaces at the beginning of each line.
        attribs - Map<String,String> Attributes to add to top node.
        dateFormat - DateFormat Date format. If null then yyyy-MM-DD HH:mm:ss pattern will be used.
        decimalFormat - NumberFormat Decimal format. If null then DecimalFormat.getNumberInstance() will be used.
        textFormat - Format. Custom formatter for text fields. May be used to encode text as HTML or similar transformations.
        Returns:
        String
